definition: to approach/to get close to/to sneak up on/near to
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle

sentences.english: He kept his seat, and shrank closer to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他還坐着，向火爐那邊更挨近些。

sentences.english: When Aaron and all the Israelites saw Moses, hisface was radiant, and they were afraid to come near him.
sentences.chinese: 亞倫和以色列衆人看見摩西的麪皮發光就怕挨近他。

sentences.english: And the people stood afar off, and Moses drew near unto the thick darkness where God [was].
sentences.chinese: 於是百姓遠遠地站立，摩西就挨近神所在的幽暗之中。

sentences.english: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.
sentences.chinese: 衆稅吏和罪人，都挨近耶穌要聽他講道。

sentences.english: Over against the border shall the rings be for places of the staves to bear the table.
sentences.chinese: 安環子的地方要挨近橫樑，可以穿槓擡桌子。

sentences.english: And when Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses， behold， the skin of his face shone； and they were afraid to come nigh him.
sentences.chinese: 亞倫和以色列衆人看見摩西的麪皮發光就怕挨近他。

sentences.english: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
sentences.chinese: 在山上被大雨淋溼，因沒有避身之處就挨近磐石。

sentences.english: Now there was leaning on Jesus' bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.
sentences.chinese: 有一個門徒，是耶穌所愛的，側身挨近耶穌的懷裏。

sentences.english: All the days that he separateth himself unto the LORD he shall come at no dead body.
sentences.chinese: 在他離俗歸耶和華的一切日子，不可挨近死屍。

sentences.english: 1Now the tax collectors and "sinners" were all gathering around to hear him.
sentences.chinese: 衆稅吏和罪人都挨近耶穌，要聽他講道。

definition: to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to move (sth) aside/to step aside/to move over (when sitting on a bench)/to shift (one's gaze)
to press against/to nuzzle up to
to wander/to shift around/to waver/to vacillate
